title: 18xx Maker
about: 18xx Maker can take 18xx game definitions written in json, display them, and render them for printing. The original intent of this site was for personal PnP projects, but the purpose has shifted over time to prototyping new games.
piracy: Do not use this app to print games that you don't have a license to print. Please support our 18xx designers, developers, and publishers.

gtg.title: Partnership with Grand Trunk Games
gtg.description: <gtg>Grand Trunk Games</gtg> is a great publisher and a big supporter of print and play. They have decided to make all of their games available on 18xx Maker as the official print and play provider! If you are able to we highly recommend supporting this publisher by purchasing their excellent productions of 1861/67 and Shikoku 1889!

credits.title: Credits
credits.description: The code is available on GitHub. We use GitHub actions, releases, and packages to handle CI, app hosting, and docker image hosting. We use Netlify to build and serve the website and the storybook.

license.title: License
license.description: The code of this project is licensed under the <license>MIT License</license> but the games contained within are not covered by this. The games are presented with no license from 18xx Maker with the permission of the publishers and/or designers.
license.permission: All games included in this repository are included with permission from the publisher and/or designer. You can make print and play copies for your own personal use. Please thank them for their support of Print and Play! If you need to inquire about the license for a game you should contact the publisher and/or designer.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.description: 18xx Maker uses a self hosted version of <plausible>Plausible</plausible> to gather some analytics. No personal data is gathered and no data is gathered about what games or files you are using and editing. The only purpose is to to know how users are accessing 18xx Maker and what features are being used so we can better focus our efforts.

donations.title: Donations
donations.description: I've been asked about donation buttons; if you find this software useful to you and would like to donate money towards its development you can do so via <paypal>Paypal</paypal>, <cash>Square Cash</cash>, or <venmo>Venmo</venmo>.

theme.label: Theme
theme.description: The theme determines which colors are used for all of the elements on the maps and tiles.

companiesTheme.label: Companies Theme
companiesTheme.description: The company theme determines which colors are used for all of the elements on the maps and tiles.

companySvgLogos.label: Company Logos
companySvgLogos.description: This lets you choose to use SVG logos (when available) for companies instead of only colors and text. The different settings are explained on the [logos doc](/docs/games/logos) page.

overrideCompanies.label: Override Companies
overrideCompanies.description: This lets you change the companies for a game to a set list that are defined in [the code](https://github.com/18xx-maker/18xx-maker/tree/master/src/data/companies).

allLayouts.label: Export all layout options
allLayouts.description: When exporting pdf components with multiple layout options, should we just export all of them?

layout.title: Layout
layout.paperSize: For reference US Letter size would be 8.5in by 11in. A4 is 210mm by 297mm.

margin.label: Margin Size
margin.description: How much of a margin exists around the printed item.

cutlines.label: Pagination Cutlines Size
cutlines.description: Set to 0 to disable any cutlines.

cutlinesOffset.label: Pagination Cutlines Offset
cutlinesOffset.description: If your method of cutting has a guide that is slightly off from where it cuts, you can adjust an offset here. Leave at 0 otherwise.

bleed.label: Pagination Bleed Size
bleed.description: Set to 0 to disable any bleed. For paginated items this detemines how much map pages overlap to help with cutting errors.

layout.label: Token Layout
layout.description: This lets you choose between different layouts when printing tokens. GSP matches the GarageSalePup AWE label sheets and overrides the values below.

marketTokenSize.label: Market Token Size
marketTokenSize.description: Size of the market tokens. 0.5 inches is the default. 12mm and 10mm are good sizes for the Rails on Boards tokens.

stationTokenSize.label: Station Token Size
stationTokenSize.description: Size of the station tokens. 0.5 inches is the default. 12mm and 10mm are good sizes for the Rails on Boards tokens.

generalTokenSize.label: General Token Size
generalTokenSize.description: Size of the tokens specified for the game. 0.5 inches is the default. 12mm and 10mm are good sizes for the Rails on Boards tokens.

reverseMarketTokens.label: Reverse Market Tokens
reverseMarketTokens.description: Whether to print token stickers for the reverse side of company market tokens. All will print a reverse token for all market tokens (normally 3 or 2 depending on the games settings).

coords.label: Coordinate Type
coords.description: This lets you choose where the coordinates appear on the map (if at all).

straightCityNames.label: Straight City Names
straightCityNames.description: Draw city names straight instead of curved along the city. None of the games included with this tool are meant to be drawn this way so layout issues might be present.

plainMapCompanies.label: Plain Map Company Spaces
plainMapCompanies.description: This sets all home/destination/token spots on maps to be empty white cities with black company text instead of colored or using logos.

plainMapDestinations.label: Plain Map Destination Spaces
plainMapDestinations.description: This sets all destination spots on maps to be empty white cities with black company text.

market.label: Display Map Market
market.description: Whether or not to show the market on the map. Requires the game file to specify the location.

players.label: Display Map Players Table
players.description: Whether or not to show the player information table on maps. This includes bank and certificate limit information. Requires the game file to specify the location.

roundTracker.label: Display Map Round Tracker
roundTracker.description: Whether or not to show the round tracker on maps. Requires the game file to specify the location.

id.label: Tile ID Location
id.description: This determines where to render the tile id.

colorblind.label: Colorblind IDs
colorblind.description: This adds a colorblind safe shape indicating the tile color to the ID section of the tile.

layout.label: Tile Sheet Layout
layout.description: This determines how to lay out the tiles on the tile sheet. Offset is the style that tries to make as few cuts as possible. Individual just has each tile separate from the others, and die is meant from the custom die cutters that Deep Thought Games uses. Setting either die option overrides page size and the tile size option below.

width.label: Tile Width
width.description: This determines the default size of tiles. It defines the distance from flat to flat. 1.5in would be standard 18xx size. 1.0625in is small (1822 / 18OE) size. GMT uses 1.75in.

mapWidth.label: Map Tile Width
mapWidth.description: This determines the default size of map hexes. This is if you want your maps drawn bigger than your tiles. Depending on how you cut your tiles this can help a lot.

gaps.label: Tile Gaps
gaps.description: This says whether to separate different colors with spaces needed to prevent bleed crossover. Leave on unless you really know you want it.

cellWidth.label: Cell Width
cellWidth.description: This determines the default width of one stock market cell.

cellHeight.label: Cell Height
cellHeight.description: This determines the default height of one stock market cell.

value.label: Value Location
value.description: This determines if the value of a cell is drawn at the top of borrom.

arrows.label: Arrow Location
arrows.description: This determines if the arrows in a cell are positioned at the top, middle or bottom.

column.label: Column Height
column.description: This determines how many cells make up a 1D market column height. The default is 4. Decimals are allowed.

diag.label: Diag Height
diag.description: This determines how many cells make up a 1Diag market cell height. The default is 2. Decimals are allowed.

par.label: Par Width
par.description: This determines how many cells make up a par market cell width. The default is 4. Decimals are allowed.

displayLegend.label: Display Market Legend
displayLegend.description: Whether or not to show the legend on markets. Requires the game file to specify the location for 2D market legends.

displayPar.label: Display Market Par Chart
displayPar.description: Whether or not to show the par chart on markets. Requires the game file to specify the location.

displayRoundTracker.label: Display Market Round Tracker
displayRoundTracker.description: Whether or not to show the round tracker on markets. Requires the game file to specify the location.

style.label: Charter Style
style.description: This lets you choose between two styles for charters. One is simular to Carth's style while the other includes more color at the top.

layout.label: Charter Layout
layout.description: Free tries to fill your page with two charters per page (by default, half width charters will change this). 3x1 and 3x2 are both designs that fit common die layouts. Either die option overrides the page size as well as the width, height and cutlines option below.

halfWidth.label: Half Width Charters
halfWidth.description: This draws all charters (major and minor) as half width. They will take up half of the width of your page (minus cutlines).

smallerMinors.label: Smaller Minors
smallerMinors.description: This draws minor charters smaller (height wise).

cutlines.label: Charter Cutlines Size
cutlines.description: Set to 0 to disable any cutlines and have the charters next to each other

bleed.label: Charter Bleed Size
bleed.description: Set to 0 to disable any bleed, or set to a value to have a margin of this amount used as the bleed amount for printing.

border.label: Charter Border Size
border.description: Set to 0 to disable any border, or set to a value to have a border of that many pixels drawn around the charter.

showPhaseChart.label: Show Phase Chart
showPhaseChart.description: Whether or not to show the phase chart on charters.

showTurnOrder.label: Show Turn Order
showTurnOrder.description: Whether or not to show the phase chart on charters.

blackBand.label: Charter Black Band
blackBand.description: Whether or not to put a black border against the color section of the charter. Only relevent to "color" charters. Always put on white color charters.

shareStyle.label: Share Style
shareStyle.description: This lets you choose between two styles for shares. One keeps the token in the center of the card, the other puts the tokens on the let (Simular to All Aboard Games and Deep Thought Games).

layout.label: Cards Layout
layout.description: Free allows cards to free flow and uses the other options below. Mini euro is for my custom die that cuts mini-euro sized cards and dtgDie uses the standard Deep Thought Games asset die. Either die option overrides the page size as well as the width, height and cutlines option below.

cutlines.label: Card Cutlines Size
cutlines.description: Set to 0 to disable any cutlines and have the cards next to each other

bleed.label: Card Bleed Size
bleed.description: Set to 0 to disable any bleed, or set to a value to have a margin of this amount used as the bleed amount for printing.

dtgPadding.label: DTG Die Padding Size
dtgPadding.description: Set to 0 to disable any padding, or set to a value to have a margin of this amount used as the padding amount per card for printing on the DTG die layout.

border.label: Card Border Size
border.description: Set to 0 to disable any border, or set to a value to have a border of that many pixels drawn around the card.

blackBand.label: Card Black Band
blackBand.description: Whether or not to put a black border against the color section of the share. Only relevent to "gmt" and "left" shares as well as trains. Always put on white color cards.

style.label: Private Style
style.description: Different styles of private cards. Small uses small icons while big uses bigger ones.

style.label: Train Style
style.description: Different styles of train cards. Color uses a large color band, while the number style uses a colored number for the train name.

images.label: Train Images
images.description: Whether or not to put some train images on the cards.

currency.title: Currency
currency.description: This lets you turn on currency symbols for each item individually. Only works if the game file specificies values as numbers and not strings.
